main.name: Jesse Alloy
main.description: With two years industry experience, I graduated in 2019 from the University of Virginia Engineering School with a second degree in Physics.
main.bio: My industry work experience to date leans front-end, though my work has also exposed me to everything from writing complex ETLs in Golang, custom API integrations in Java, CLIs in bash, and webscrapers in Python. I have also worked within our alerting system, which uses Go, Prometheus, and Alertmanager on the infrastructure side. Additionally I have educational focus in algorithms, which includes working as a teaching assistant, as well completing grad level course work and research in the broader field.
main.contactmessage: For ease, please feel free to contact me with the form below. otherwise, my personal contact information is also listed!

resume.skillmessage: Self-ratings of relevant development languages, frameworks, and other skills.

education.description: Relevant or unique coursework in Avanced Algorithms, Software Testing, Computer Vision, and Cyber Security.
Supplementing my primary degree in Computer Science, Physics pushed me mathematically, logically, and in critical and expansive thought processes.

work.title: Software Engineer
work.years: SWE II August 2019 - September 2020, SWE III September 2020 - Present
work.description: Built Yext Pages sites (bespoke static landing pages) for Fortune 500 clients using ES6 Javascript, Sass, Webpack, and Soy templates (e.g findadealer.motability.co.uk).

descriptions.one: Worked on the 'Consulting Team' on Yext's 'Pages' Product.
descriptions.two: Primarily working as a front end developer, coding in JS, scss, HTML5, Cofeescript, and the front end templating language known as 'Soy Templates'

work.title: Teaching Assistant
work.description: Worked as a teaching assistant for an introductory core algorithms course for undergraduates. Lead tutoring sessions and aided in content creation and vetting (Homeworks and Tests).
